trans-unit.source: Represents a header that encapsulates an address information item used to identify or interact with an endpoint.
An <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader> is characterized by a name and namespace and has a value that contains optional information used to identify or interact with an endpoint.
The name can be accessed by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.Name%2A> property and the namespace by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.Namespace%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.CreateAddressHeader%2A> to create new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader> objects.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> class with a specified value.
The information item for the address header.
The that contains the information item specified by the value parameter.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> class using a specified formatter to serialize the information item from a specified object.
The information item for the address header.
The used to serialize the specified object in the value parameter.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> that contains the information item specified by the value parameter.
The formatter is `null`.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> class with a specified value, name and namespace.
The name of the address header.
The namespace of the address header.
The information item for the address header.
The with the specified name and ns that contains the information item specified by value.
The name is `null` or name.Length == 0.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> class with a specified name and namespace that uses a specified formatter to serialize the information item from a specified object.
The name of the address header.
The namespace of the address header.
The information item for the address header.
The used to serialize the specified object in the value parameter.
The with the specified name and ns that contains the information item specified by value.
name or serializer is `null` or name.Length == 0.
Determines whether the information item in a specified object is equal to the object contained in the current address header.
Checks for equivalence of serialized canonical XML between the information items.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the object contained in the current address header.
`true` if the information item in a specified obj is equivalent to the information item contained in the current address header; otherwise, `false`.
In particular, returns `false` if obj is `null`.
Returns an XML reader that can serialize the current address header object.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> that can serialize the current address header object.
Provides a unique hash code for an address header.
This is the string-based implementation.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.GetHashCode%2A> is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A unique hash code for the current address header.
Deserializes the information item from the current address header to an object of a specified type that uses a specified formatter to serialize this information.
When using this overload, you must supply a type for the generic parameter `T`.
The type of the return value is determined by the generic type parameter.
Use this overload only if you want to use a customized XML formatter; otherwise use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.GetValue%60%601> overload.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> used to deserialize the information item from the current address header object.
A class of type T with its fields and properties set to the values supplied by the current address header object.
An instance of a class of type T with its fields and properties set to the values supplied by the current address header object.
The serializer is `null`.
Deserializes the information item from the current address header to an object of a specified type.
When using this overload, you must supply a type for the generic parameter `T`.
The type of the return value is determined by the generic type parameter.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.GetValue%60%601%28System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer%29> overload if you want to use a customized XML formatter.
A class of type T with its fields and properties set to the values supplied by the current address header object.
An instance of a class of type T with its fields and properties set to the values supplied by the current address header object.
When implemented, gets the name of the address header.
The name of the address header.
When implemented, gets the namespace of the address header.
The namespace of the address header.
When overridden in a derived class, is invoked when the address header contents are written to a stream or file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the address header contents to a stream or file.
When overridden in a derived class, is invoked when the address header contents begin to be written to a stream or file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the address header to a stream or file.
Wraps the address header as a message header.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeader"></xref> that wraps the current address header.
Writes the address header to a stream or file using a specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
This overload calls the abstract
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.OnWriteAddressHeaderContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> method, so users must provide an implementation of that method to use this method.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the address header to a stream or file.
The writer is `null`.
Writes the address header to a stream or file using a specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
This overload wraps <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> as a <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> and then the calls the abstract
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader.OnWriteAddressHeaderContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> method.
Users must provide an implementation for that abstract method to use this overload.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the address header to a stream or file.
The writer is `null`.
Writes the address header contents to a stream or file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the address header contents to a stream or file.
The writer is `null`.
Starts to write the address header contents to a stream or file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the address header to a stream or file.
The writer is `null`.
